name: Découvrez et enrichissez les décideurs avec Apollo et la vérification humaine
description:
## 🧩 Ce que fait ce workflow
Ce workflow automatise le processus d'identification et d'enrichissement des contacts des décideurs à partir d'une liste d'entreprises. En s'intégrant aux API d'Apollo et à Google Sheets, il rationalise la génération de leads, garantit l'exactitude des données grâce à la vérification humaine et maintient une base de données de leads organisée.

## 📚 Cas d'utilisation
Idéal pour les équipes de vente et de marketing visant à :
- Automatiser la découverte des décideurs clés (par exemple, PDG, CTO).
- Enrichir les informations de contact avec des profils LinkedIn, des e-mails et des numéros de téléphone.
- Maintenir une base de données de leads à jour avec un minimum d'intervention manuelle.
- Recevoir des résumés hebdomadaires des nouveaux leads vérifiés.

## 🧪 Configuration
**1.** Préparation de Google Sheets :

- Utilisez la feuille Google préconfigurée suivante : [Feuille de découverte des décideurs d'entreprise](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KqKFZ7Uxrt1MivBjLklGdPRMgNBhEc0slpthoSjt2wI/edit?gid=0#gid=0).
- Ce tableur comprend les onglets et colonnes nécessaires : `Entreprises`, `Contacts` et `Contacts (Vérifiés)`.
- Il contient également une fonction Apps Script `onEdit` personnalisée qui met automatiquement à jour la colonne Statut en `En attente` chaque fois que le champ Domaine est modifié.
- Pour examiner ou modifier le script, accédez à __Extensions > Apps Script__ dans la feuille Google.

**2.** Configuration des identifiants :

- Configurez les identifiants suivants dans votre instance n8n :
	- Google Sheets : Pour lire et écrire dans la feuille de calcul.
	- Slack : Pour envoyer des demandes de vérification et des rapports hebdomadaires.
	- Apollo : Pour accéder aux API de recherche d'organisation, d'enrichissement d'organisation, de recherche de personnes et d'enrichissement en masse de personnes.
	- Service LLM (par exemple, OpenAI) : Pour générer des résumés d'entreprise et déterminer les départements en fonction des titres de poste.

**3.** Configuration du workflow :

- Importez le workflow dans votre instance n8n.
- Mettez à jour les nœuds pour référencer la bonne feuille Google et le canal Slack.
- Assurez-vous que les nœuds Apollo et LLM ont les clés API et les configurations appropriées.

**4.** Test du workflow :

- Ajoutez une nouvelle entrée d'entreprise dans l'onglet Entreprises de la feuille Google.
- Vérifiez que le workflow se déclenche automatiquement, traite les données et met à jour les onglets Contacts et Contacts (Vérifiés) en conséquence.
- Vérifiez Slack pour toute demande de vérification et confirmez que les rapports hebdomadaires sont envoyés comme prévu.

parameters.message: Please review the Companies tab of the spreadsheet (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Nt7cBLwwIr7kRCj6VL3wQDqfkfbL3j_dwlHHpExrL_s/edit?gid=0#gid=0) to verify that the correct domain names were retrieved. If needed, simply find and paste correct website URL of the company in the Website column (the Domain column will be populated automatically).

documentId.cachedResultName: Copy of Company Decision Maker Discovery

values.content: =Given the company description "{{ $json["Company Description"] }}", summarize the company’s core business in one line.

parameters.content:
# 🏢 Company Decision Maker Discovery
This workflow processes a list of companies (optionally with their websites to improve search accuracy) and outputs a curated list of decision-makers (e.g., CEO, COO, CTO, VP, Director) along with their contact information (LinkedIn, email, phone) into a structured leads database. It also sends out a weekly report to a Slack channel, specifying the number of verified leads generated over the past week.​

Here's the [Google Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KqKFZ7Uxrt1MivBjLklGdPRMgNBhEc0slpthoSjt2wI/edit?gid=0#gid=0) template for this workflow.

You can explore the Apps Script code in the sheet via __Extensions > App Script__

## ⚙️ Workflow Trigger 👇
The main workflow is triggered by adding or updating a row in the Companies tab of a Google Sheet. You can provide the company's name and website (the domain will be extracted automatically in the spreadsheet). Alternatively, you may provide only the company name, allowing the Apollo Organization Search API to retrieve the website. 

![Entrypoint](https://i.postimg.cc/s2DT8K2n/decision-maker-1.png#full-width)

nodes.name: Split Out Batched Decision Maker Response

parameters.content:
### 🔄 Status Management ☝️
To avoid unintentional duplicate lead extraction from companies, we use a filter to retrieve only companies where the value of the Status column isn't "Processed". Note that if the website of a "Processed" company is edited, the status changes back to "Pending" as configured via an Apps Script function.

### 🏢 Company Enrichment ☝️
With company domains present in the spreadsheet, we utilize the Apollo Organization Enrichment endpoint to extract details about the companies. Subsequently, we generate a one-line summary of each company's core business via an LLM and populate the Companies tab of the spreadsheet, setting the Status to "Processed".

### 👥 Decision Maker Discovery ☝️
We employ the Apollo People Search endpoint to find decision-makers at the companies. A crucial query parameter is q_organization_domains_list[], which accepts up to 1,000 domains in a single request. To accommodate scenarios with over 1,000 companies, we batch the API calls (1,000 per batch) and dynamically construct the full search URL for each batch using a Code node.

### 🧠 Data Processing and Upsertion 👇
A Split Out node enables handling the batched API response. We generate each decision maker's department based on their job title using an LLM call and upsert the results into the Contacts tab of the spreadsheet.

### 📧 Contact Enrichment ☝️
Since the Apollo People Search endpoint doesn't retrieve email addresses and phone numbers, we make additional calls to the Bulk People Enrichment endpoint to enrich data for up to 10 people with a single API call. Using a Code node, we construct the dynamic endpoint URL for each batch of 10 people, split the batched enrichment response data, and upsert the Contacts tab again.

### ✅ Verified Contacts Filtering
At this stage, the Contacts tab may contain both verified and unverified email addresses. We filter and select only contacts with verified email addresses using the following spreadsheet formula in cell A2 of the Contacts (Verified) tab:​

__=FILTER(Contacts!A2:M, Contacts!L2:L = "Yes")__

nodes.name: Derive Past Week's Lead Gen. Metrics

parameters.content:
### 📊 Weekly Report ☝️
This step is configured to automatically send out a summary message every week, reporting the number of new verified leads discovered over the past 7 days.
![weekly-report.png](https://i.postimg.cc/3NsvjryM/weekly-report.png#full-width)

### 🧑‍💼 Human-in-the-Loop Verification 👇
Since the retrieved website may not always be accurate, a human-in-the-loop step (via Slack) is required to verify the returned websites in the spreadsheet, make corrections if needed, and approve.

![slack-approve.png](https://i.postimg.cc/J0FnVRZT/slack-approve.png#full-width)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
